metadata.title: CVE-2016-10708 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via an out-of-sequenceNEWKEYS message, as demonstrated by Honggfuzz, related to kex.c andpacket.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10708` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.6
openssh-client-ssh1 - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.6
openssh-server - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.6
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.6
ssh - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.6
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.6
ssh-krb5 - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.6').
